p: As shown in Figure 7d, mixture-A (MgCl 2·6H 2O-NH 4Al(SO 4) 2·12H 2O) has multiple weight loss steps, which are different from those of MgCl 2·6H 2O and NH 4Al(SO 4) 2·12H 2O. In particular, the mixture exhibits a lower onset decomposition temperature as compared to its two components because of its lower phase change temperature (64.15 °C). Moreover, a weight loss of 19.79% occurred for the mixture at the temperature of 143.23 °C. The experimental results suggest that the thermal property of mixture-A is different from those of MgCl 2·6H 2O and NH 4Al(SO 4) 2·12H 2O, verifying the formation of the mixture between two components. It can be seen from Figure 7e that mixture-B has a similar process of weight loss as mixture-A. And the final weight loss (49.45%) of mixture-B ( Figure 7e, MgCl 2·6H 2O-KAl(SO 4) 2·12H 2O) is between those of MgCl 2·6H 2O (58.07%) and KAl(SO 4) 2·12H 2O (44.01%).
